Results: won for the first time by Qatar, who defeated Japan 3–1 in the Final.
Denmark, in a clean sweep, won their first title by defeating Norway 31–22 in the final.
Novak Djokovic won the men's singles, defeating Rafael Nadal. Naomi Osaka defeated Petra Kvitová in the women's singles.
athletes competed in 6 skiing events, 8 snowboarding events, 1 snowmobiling event and 5 snow bike events
Wales won for the first time since 2013, beating defending champions Ireland, and also achieving a Grand Slam.
The New England Patriots beat the Los Angeles Rams 13-3, in the lowest-scoring Super Bowl game in history
Norway and Switzerland shared to most medals, each with 2 gold and 4 in total
Norway dominated the medal tally with 25 medals (the next best was Germany with 9)
Netherlands and Australia both won 6 gold medals
For the first time bandy and ski-orienteering were included, with Bandy having bigger crowds than any other sport.
featuring 200 nations and more than 7,000 athletes.
won by 4/1 favorite Tiger Roll, the first horse since Red Rum in 1974 to win back-to-back Nationals.
Tiger Woods won his fifth Green Jacket. It was his fifteenth major, his first in more than 10 years.
Won by Judd Trump, who defeated John Higgins 18–9 in the final to claim his first World Championship.
Chinese athletes won all five gold medals on offer
Maximum Security crossed the finish line first, though after a protest the race was awarded to long shot Country House
Finland won their third title by defeating Canada in the final

Location: Bethpage State Park, Black Course, Farmingdale, New York
Results: Brooks Koepka won his 2nd PGA Championship by two strokes ahead of Dustin Johnson. He became the first player to successfully defend both the PGA Championship and the U.S. Open in a career.
Manchester City beat Watford 6–0, the joint largest winning margin in an FA Cup Final
Simon Pagenaud of Team Penske won the race from the pole position, a record-extending 18th Indy 500 victory for the team.

In the men's final, defending champion Rafael Nadal defeated Dominic Thiem in a rematch of the 2018 final. In the women's singles, Australian Ash Barty won her first Grand Slam singles title, defeating Markéta Vondroušová.
St. Louis Blues defeated Boston Bruins 4-3 to win their first championship
Toronto Raptors defeated the Golden State Warriors 4–2, their first NBA championship and also the first win by a team based outside the USA.
England and New Zealand played in a thrilling final which ended in a tie, followed by a Super Over which was also tied, the title awarded to England on a countback.
Played between two English sides, Liverpool defeated Tottenham Hotspur 2–0 in the final
USA defended their title with a 2–0 victory over the Netherlands in the final.
Gary Woodland won his first major title by three strokes over world number one Brooks Koepka.

Location: Circuit de la Sarthe, Le Mans, France
Results: The race was won by the No. 8 Toyota of Fernando Alonso, Sébastien Buemi and Kazuki Nakajima, their second consecutive Le Mans victory.
Algeria defeated Senegal 1–0 in the final, winning their second title
The 2nd European Games featured 200 events in 15 sports (23 disciplines). The medal tally was dominated by Russia.

Russians Oleg Stoyanovskiy and Viacheslav Krasilnikov defeated the German team of Julius Thole and Clemens Wickler to win the men's title. The women's title was won by the US team of Sarah Pavan and Melissa Humana-Paredes, who defeated Canadians Alix Klineman and April Ross.
Defending champion Novak Djokovic successfully defended his title, defeating Roger Federer. In the women's final Simona Halep defeated Serena Williams.
About 6000 athletes from 118 nations participated, with Japan leading the medal table.
The general classification was won by Egan Bernal of Team Ineos. His teammate and 2018 Tour winner Geraint Thomas finished second.
A total of 26 sports were contested. New Caledonia led the medal tally, ahead of Papua New Guinea and host country Samoa.
In a rematch of the 2015 final, New Zealand won their fifth title, defeating Australia by one goal.
China won the most gold medals, though the USA won more medals overall.

Location: Royal Portrush Golf Club, County Antrim, Northern Ireland
Results: Won by Shane Lowry, his first major title, and the second for a player from the Republic of Ireland.
the leading country was Mauritius
All 41 members nations of the Pan American Sports Organization competed, with the USA dominating the medal table.
Australian athletes took home the most gold medals (though the US won the most overall)
The Games attract thousands of competitors from up to 80 countries contesting 54+ sports
The Games featured 26 sports, with Egyptian athletes clearly winning the most medals
The gold medals were spread among 15 nations, with new Zealand finishing with 4 gold.

Rafael Nadal won his 19th Grand Slam singles title, defeating Daniil Medvedev. Bianca Andreescu won the women's singles title, defeating Serena Williams, becoming the first Canadian to win a Grand Slam singles title.

Argentina defeated Spain 95-75 in the final. Defending champions, the USA, experienced their worst result at a World Cup, losing to France in the quarter-finals and Serbia in the subsequent classification game.
Boxers from Uzbekistan and Russia won 3 gold medals each.
This inaugural event was designed to showcase new, urban sports
After the first 2 days the competition was tied at 8-all. Europe won the singles 6½–5½ to win the Cup for the first time since 2013.
Chinese athletes dominated the medal table, winning half the gold medals on offer
South Africa beat England 32−12 in the final, claiming their third title, equaling New Zealand's record.
Mads Pedersen of Denmark won the men's road race and Annemiek van Vleuten of the Netherlands won the women's event.
world records were set in the women's 400 meters hurdles and the mixed 4 × 400 meters relay.
Richmond beat the Giants 114 to 25. Richmond's Dustin Martin was awarded his second Norm Smith Medal
USA, Russia and Great Britain share most of the medals on offer.
Sydney Roosters defeated the Canberra Raiders The match was won by the Roosters 14–8 in a tight contest to claim their 15th premiership title.
Russian boxers won three gold medals.
These inaugural World Beach Games featured 14 disciplines in 13 sports
over 9000 athletes competed in 27 sports
The Washington Nationals beat Houston Astros 4-3, to secure their first title in franchise history.
Japan defeated South Korea in the final, and the bronze medal game was won by Mexico over Team USA.
The race was won by Vow And Declare, ridden by Craig Williams and trained by Danny O'Brien
In the new format for the Davis Cup, Spain won their sixth title, defeating Canada 2–0. Rafael Nadal won the Most Valuable Player (MVP) award.
A record of 530 events in 56 sports. The medal tally was comprehensively won by the Philippines.
The Netherlands won their first title after defeating Spain in the final
The US led by Tiger Woods, clawed back a huge lead on the final day to win 16–14. It was the 8th straight Presidents Cup victory for the USA.
